title: Justice Reform: Practical Steps for Community Advocacy
content:
Justice reform needs both data-driven policy and community engagement. In this post we outline three practical steps organisations can take to build local advocacy coalitions, collect meaningful evidence, and engage policymakers effectively.

1. Map stakeholders
2. Collect and present data
3. Use storytelling to drive policy change

References: UAACAI research series, 2024.

title: How to Run Impactful Community Events (Checklist & Toolkit)
content: Events are powerful ways to mobilise stakeholders. This article includes a practical checklist, budgeting tips, and a sample promotional timeline. Whether you're running a webinar or an in-person forum, follow these steps to increase turnout and measurable impact.
